docs.title: 2nd workshop on open science in aviation 🌷 tangram
docs.text:
We are pleased to announce the 2nd edition of this workshop on 3 and 4 April 2025 in TU Delft 🇳🇱 (The Netherlands), following the success of the 1st workshop on open-source tools for air traffic management and research on mercury open-source tool.

The workshop aims at discussing and sharing experiences in making aviation research more open and accessible.

We will also present a new open-source tool, tangram, which is a modular framework for real-time data analysis and visualization.

docs.title: Logistics
docs.text: Date 3–4 April 2025 (Thu + Fri) Location Faculty of Aerospace Engineering, TU Delft Address Kluyverweg 1, 2629 HS Delft

docs.title: Registration
docs.text: The workshop is free of charge. However, for logistics purposes, we ask you to register using the online form.

docs.title: Agenda (tentative)
docs.text: The current agenda is still subject to minor adjustments. Abstracts of presentations will be announced soon.

docs.title: Day 1 · Part 1 – Open science in aviation
docs.text:
09:00 – Welcome Coffee

09:30 – Welcome and Keynote Jacco Hoekstra (TU Delft)

10:00 – Open science in aviation, where are we now? Junzi Sun (TU Delft)

10:30 – Good practices for open science Tanya Yankelevich (TU Delft Open Science Community)

11:00 – How to open your code when part of it cannot be shared ? Xavier Olive (ONERA)

docs.title: Day 1 · Part 2 – Open data in aviation
docs.text:
The afternoon consists of two hands-on sessions. Laptops are sufficient (an internet connection will be available), and basic knowledge of Python for data science is expected.

13:00 – A tour through aviation sources of data (hands-on session) Gerald Gurtner (University of Westminster)

15:00 – Around OpenSky Network data: what is available and what is not? (hands-on session) Junzi Sun, Xavier Olive

docs.title: Day 2 · Part 3 – Real-time aviation data analysis
docs.text: 9:00 – tangram: aviation data analysis on real-time data Xavier Olive, Junzi Sun

docs.title: Registration
docs.text: The workshop is free of charge. However, for logistics purposes, we ask you to register using the online form.
